alert.note: Alert for Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 8:36PM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS MAY LEAD TO BLOWING SNOW AND ICY ROADS TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY... Southerly winds will increase after midnight and continue well into Sunday. Sustained southwest winds of 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts of 40 to 45 mph will be possible after 3am. These strong gusts may continue well into Sunday. Strong winds may lead to areas of blowing snow and minor drifting over roads, which could reduce visibility under a couple miles at times. Further into Sunday, warming road surfaces may become susceptible to a melt and refreeze of drifting snow, which could also impact travel with stretches of icy roads.
